text: Compare the equations in this problem to those in Problem 3.1. How are they similar? How are they different? Describe how an equation might be useful to answer questions about a situation.

Equations in Problem 3.1

C = 3.00n

d = 40t

d = 50t

d = 60t

These equations are related to multiplication.

You can calculate the dependent variable by multiplying the coefficient by the independent variable.

Equations in Problem 3.2

D = C − 50

T = P − 20

P + 10 = T

These equations are related to addition or subtraction. You can calculate the dependent variable by subtracting (or adding) the fees/discounts to the independent variable.

They are similar in that they show the relationship between two variables.

They are different in that equations in Problem 3.2 use addition and subtraction, whereas equations in Problem 3.1 use multiplication.

Depending on the problem situation, you might need to know the appropriate dependent variable or independent variable. By using an equation, as long as you know the value of one variable, you can calculate the value of the other variable.
